docs.lead_paragraph: Defying pressure for a strong increase in defense spending, China said on Saturday its military budget this year would grow about 7 percent, its slowest pace since 2010.

headline.main: China's 2017 Defense Budget Rise to Slow Again
headline.print_headline: China's 2017 Defense Budget Rise to Slow Again

docs.snippet: Defying pressure for a strong increase in defense spending, China said on Saturday its military budget this year would grow about 7 percent, its slowest pace since 2010....

docs.lead_paragraph: Mrs. Rice was an analyst at the Social Security Administration when its study on aging highlighted how about half the population 65 and over had no health insurance.

docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. Attorney General Jeff Sessions will reply in writing to Senate Democrats' questions about his meetings with Russia's ambassador last year, the Justice Department said on Friday after a top Republican denied Democrats' request for a public hearing.

docs.lead_paragraph: Jeanie Buss, the Lakers’ president and controlling owner, withdrew her court request after her brothers backed down on calling for a board meeting she felt was a move against her.

docs.lead_paragraph: Ri Jong Chol, a suspect in the murder of the estranged half-brother of North Korea's leader, said in Beijing that he was a victim of a conspiracy by Malaysian authorities attempting to damage the honor of North Korea.

docs.lead_paragraph: China has no plans to implement a nationwide property tax this year, the spokeswoman for China's parliament said on Saturday, despite mounting expectations that such measures would soon be introduced to restrain surging property prices.

headline.main: China to Defer Implementation of Property Tax Despite Surging Prices
headline.print_headline: China to Defer Implementation of Property Tax Despite Surging Prices

docs.lead_paragraph: Malaysia on Saturday rejected any suggestion it may have violated sanctions imposed by the United Nations on North Korea, after a Reuters report said North Korea-linked firms were running an arms network in the country.

headline.main: Malaysia Rejects 'Insinuation' It Violated U.N. Sanctions on North Korea
headline.print_headline: Malaysia Rejects 'Insinuation' It Violated U.N. Sanctions on North Korea
